issueType: Early Sexual Anxiety Information and Inclusion

title.hindi: सीखने और घबराहट को सामान्य बनाएं

description.english: Explain that feeling nervous about body/sex topics is common and reduces with practice and good info. How it works example: Start classes with 'It’s okay not to know'; share one myth-to-fact each week to show learning progress.
description.hindi: Explain that feeling nervous about body/sex topics is common and reduces with practice and good info. How it works example: Start classes with 'It’s okay not to know'; share one myth-to-fact each week to show learning progress.
description.marathi: Explain that feeling nervous about body/sex topics is common and reduces with practice and good info. How it works example: Start classes with 'It’s okay not to know'; share one myth-to-fact each week to show learning progress.

description.english: Adopt person-first, gender-neutral terms and ask preferred words to reduce shame and confusion. How it works example: Ask 'What words feel right for your body/identity?' Mirror their terms and use they/them until clarified.
description.hindi: Adopt person-first, gender-neutral terms and ask preferred words to reduce shame and confusion. How it works example: Ask 'What words feel right for your body/identity?' Mirror their terms and use they/them until clarified.

title.hindi: भावनाएं और शरीर के संकेतों का मानचित्र

description.english: Teach kids to notice thoughts, emotions, and body cues when topics feel uncomfortable. How it works example: Create a simple map: Situation—new word; Feeling—nervous 6/10; Body—tummy knot; Action—raise hand for a pause.
description.hindi: Teach kids to notice thoughts, emotions, and body cues when topics feel uncomfortable. How it works example: Create a simple map: Situation—new word; Feeling—nervous 6/10; Body—tummy knot; Action—raise hand for a pause.
description.marathi: Teach kids to notice thoughts, emotions, and body cues when topics feel uncomfortable. How it works example: Create a simple map: Situation—new word; Feeling—nervous 6/10; Body—tummy knot; Action—raise hand for a pause.

title.hindi: सभी इंटरैक्शन के लिए सहमति की मूल बातें
title.marathi: सर्व परस्पर क्रियांसाठी सहमती की मूलतत्वे

description.english: Introduce age-appropriate consent (asking, listening, respecting no/stop). How it works example: Practice: 'Can I give you a high-five?' Respect 'no' and offer alternatives like a wave or smile.
description.hindi: Introduce age-appropriate consent (asking, listening, respecting no/stop). How it works example: Practice: 'Can I give you a high-five?' Respect 'no' and offer alternatives like a wave or smile.
description.marathi: Introduce age-appropriate consent (asking, listening, respecting no/stop). How it works example: Practice: 'Can I give you a high-five?' Respect 'no' and offer alternatives like a wave or smile.

description.english: Sequence lessons from neutral to more sensitive content, advancing only when comfort improves. How it works example: Start with body safety rules → feelings → anatomy terms → puberty changes; check comfort ratings before moving on.
description.hindi: Sequence lessons from neutral to more sensitive content, advancing only when comfort improves. How it works example: Start with body safety rules → feelings → anatomy terms → puberty changes; check comfort ratings before moving on.
description.marathi: Sequence lessons from neutral to more sensitive content, advancing only when comfort improves. How it works example: Start with body safety rules → feelings → anatomy terms → puberty changes; check comfort ratings before moving on.

description.english: Teach quick calming skills before/after lessons to lower arousal. How it works example: 60-second 5-4-3-2-1 senses scan plus two slow exhales; resume learning when intensity ≤3/10.
description.hindi: Teach quick calming skills before/after lessons to lower arousal. How it works example: 60-second 5-4-3-2-1 senses scan plus two slow exhales; resume learning when intensity ≤3/10.
description.marathi: Teach quick calming skills before/after lessons to lower arousal. How it works example: 60-second 5-4-3-2-1 senses scan plus two slow exhales; resume learning when intensity ≤3/10.

description.english: Compare media/porn/social posts with real-life, consent-based expectations. How it works example: Show a claim, ask 'Is this realistic, kind, and safe?' Replace with age-appropriate facts and inclusive examples.
description.hindi: Compare media/porn/social posts with real-life, consent-based expectations. How it works example: Show a claim, ask 'Is this realistic, kind, and safe?' Replace with age-appropriate facts and inclusive examples.
description.marathi: Compare media/porn/social posts with real-life, consent-based expectations. How it works example: Show a claim, ask 'Is this realistic, kind, and safe?' Replace with age-appropriate facts and inclusive examples.

description.english: Create simple worksheets mapping situation → thought → feeling (0–10) → body sensation → action. How it works example: Situation—health class term; Thought—'This is bad'; Feeling—fear 6/10; Body—stomach flip; Action—ask for pause + deep breaths.
description.hindi: Create simple worksheets mapping situation → thought → feeling (0–10) → body sensation → action. How it works example: Situation—health class term; Thought—'This is bad'; Feeling—fear 6/10; Body—stomach flip; Action—ask for pause + deep breaths.
description.marathi: Create simple worksheets mapping situation → thought → feeling (0–10) → body sensation → action. How it works example: Situation—health class term; Thought—'This is bad'; Feeling—fear 6/10; Body—stomach flip; Action—ask for pause + deep breaths.

description.english: Build a deck of common anxious thoughts with balanced responses in kid‑friendly words. How it works example: Card: 'If I ask, I’m weird.' Balanced: 'Questions help me learn; adults can handle it kindly.' Use before/after class.
description.hindi: Build a deck of common anxious thoughts with balanced responses in kid‑friendly words. How it works example: Card: 'If I ask, I’m weird.' Balanced: 'Questions help me learn; adults can handle it kindly.' Use before/after class.
description.marathi: Build a deck of common anxious thoughts with balanced responses in kid‑friendly words. How it works example: Card: 'If I ask, I’m weird.' Balanced: 'Questions help me learn; adults can handle it kindly.' Use before/after class.

description.english: Create a step ladder from neutral to harder topics; repeat each step until anxiety ≤3/10 before moving up. How it works example: Name body parts → consent basics → crush feelings → puberty changes; rehearse with calm breathing.
description.hindi: Create a step ladder from neutral to harder topics; repeat each step until anxiety ≤3/10 before moving up. How it works example: Name body parts → consent basics → crush feelings → puberty changes; rehearse with calm breathing.
description.marathi: Create a step ladder from neutral to harder topics; repeat each step until anxiety ≤3/10 before moving up. How it works example: Name body parts → consent basics → crush feelings → puberty changes; rehearse with calm breathing.

description.english: Test predictions gently and record outcomes to update beliefs. How it works example: Prediction—'Teacher will be mad if I ask.' Test—ask privately; Outcome—teacher thanks you; Learning—fear drops; Belief—'It’s okay to ask.'
description.hindi: Test predictions gently and record outcomes to update beliefs. How it works example: Prediction—'Teacher will be mad if I ask.' Test—ask privately; Outcome—teacher thanks you; Learning—fear drops; Belief—'It’s okay to ask.'
description.marathi: Test predictions gently and record outcomes to update beliefs. How it works example: Prediction—'Teacher will be mad if I ask.' Test—ask privately; Outcome—teacher thanks you; Learning—fear drops; Belief—'It’s okay to ask.'

description.english: Identify avoidant habits (changing topic, looking down) and fade one at a time using coping skills. How it works example: Practice one clear sentence ('Can you explain that word?') while keeping eye contact for 3 seconds.
description.hindi: Identify avoidant habits (changing topic, looking down) and fade one at a time using coping skills. How it works example: Practice one clear sentence ('Can you explain that word?') while keeping eye contact for 3 seconds.
description.marathi: Identify avoidant habits (changing topic, looking down) and fade one at a time using coping skills. How it works example: Practice one clear sentence ('Can you explain that word?') while keeping eye contact for 3 seconds.

description.english: Role‑play asking for help, saying no/stop, and using inclusive terms to build confidence. How it works example: Script—'I’m not ready; can we slow down?' Practice with a trusted adult, then use in class or peer settings.
description.hindi: Role‑play asking for help, saying no/stop, and using inclusive terms to build confidence. How it works example: Script—'I’m not ready; can we slow down?' Practice with a trusted adult, then use in class or peer settings.
description.marathi: Role‑play asking for help, saying no/stop, and using inclusive terms to build confidence. How it works example: Script—'I’m not ready; can we slow down?' Practice with a trusted adult, then use in class or peer settings.

description.english: Teach short grounding (5‑4‑3‑2‑1 senses, 4‑7‑8 breathing) to lower arousal before/after lessons. How it works example: Do 60 seconds of senses scan, then one 4‑7‑8 cycle; resume when fear ≤3/10.
description.hindi: Teach short grounding (5‑4‑3‑2‑1 senses, 4‑7‑8 breathing) to lower arousal before/after lessons. How it works example: Do 60 seconds of senses scan, then one 4‑7‑8 cycle; resume when fear ≤3/10.
description.marathi: Teach short grounding (5‑4‑3‑2‑1 senses, 4‑7‑8 breathing) to lower arousal before/after lessons. How it works example: Do 60 seconds of senses scan, then one 4‑7‑8 cycle; resume when fear ≤3/10.

description.english: Identify guiding values (kindness, respect, safety) and pick small actions aligned with them. How it works example: Value—respect; Action—ask permission before high‑five and use correct terms; log pride level afterward.
description.hindi: Identify guiding values (kindness, respect, safety) and pick small actions aligned with them. How it works example: Value—respect; Action—ask permission before high‑five and use correct terms; log pride level afterward.
description.marathi: Identify guiding values (kindness, respect, safety) and pick small actions aligned with them. How it works example: Value—respect; Action—ask permission before high‑five and use correct terms; log pride level afterward.

description.english: List triggers, early signs, coping steps, and helpers; keep it on a card/phone. How it works example: Trigger—jokes; Signs—heart race; Steps—breathe, use boundary script, tell trusted adult, schedule calming activity later.
description.hindi: List triggers, early signs, coping steps, and helpers; keep it on a card/phone. How it works example: Trigger—jokes; Signs—heart race; Steps—breathe, use boundary script, tell trusted adult, schedule calming activity later.
description.marathi: List triggers, early signs, coping steps, and helpers; keep it on a card/phone. How it works example: Trigger—jokes; Signs—heart race; Steps—breathe, use boundary script, tell trusted adult, schedule calming activity later.

description.english: Identify rigid demands that raise anxiety (e.g., 'I must never feel awkward,' 'Teachers should never use those words'). How it works example: Keep a tally of 'must/should' for one week; when one appears, label it 'Demand' and rewrite as a preference.
description.hindi: Identify rigid demands that raise anxiety (e.g., 'I must never feel awkward,' 'Teachers should never use those words'). How it works example: Keep a tally of 'must/should' for one week; when one appears, label it 'Demand' and rewrite as a preference.

description.english: Challenge 'It will be awful if I ask a question' with truth, logic, and usefulness tests. How it works example: Ask: Is it 100% true? Does feeling awkward = disaster? Does this belief help me learn? Replace with a calmer, realistic belief.
description.hindi: Challenge 'It will be awful if I ask a question' with truth, logic, and usefulness tests. How it works example: Ask: Is it 100% true? Does feeling awkward = disaster? Does this belief help me learn? Replace with a calmer, realistic belief.

description.english: Build flexible beliefs focused on coping (preferences, probabilities, tolerability). How it works example: Change 'I must know it all now' to 'I’d prefer to understand; it’s okay to learn step by step, and I can handle brief discomfort.'
description.hindi: Build flexible beliefs focused on coping (preferences, probabilities, tolerability). How it works example: Change 'I must know it all now' to 'I’d prefer to understand; it’s okay to learn step by step, and I can handle brief discomfort.'
description.marathi: Build flexible beliefs focused on coping (preferences, probabilities, tolerability). How it works example: Change 'I must know it all now' to 'I’d prefer to understand; it’s okay to learn step by step, and I can handle brief discomfort.'

description.english: Separate self-worth from moments of confusion, blushes, or questions. How it works example: After stumbling on a term, say: 'I’m okay as a person even when I’m learning; making mistakes doesn’t define me.' Repeat before/after classes.
description.hindi: Separate self-worth from moments of confusion, blushes, or questions. How it works example: After stumbling on a term, say: 'I’m okay as a person even when I’m learning; making mistakes doesn’t define me.' Repeat before/after classes.

description.english: View others as fallible without global condemnation while setting limits on unhelpful behavior. How it works example: Reframe 'That teacher is terrible' to 'The teacher used a word I didn’t know; I’ll ask for clarification calmly.'
description.hindi: View others as fallible without global condemnation while setting limits on unhelpful behavior. How it works example: Reframe 'That teacher is terrible' to 'The teacher used a word I didn’t know; I’ll ask for clarification calmly.'
description.marathi: View others as fallible without global condemnation while setting limits on unhelpful behavior. How it works example: Reframe 'That teacher is terrible' to 'The teacher used a word I didn’t know; I’ll ask for clarification calmly.'

description.english: Grow 'I can stand it' beliefs for short-term discomfort during inclusive discussions. How it works example: During a 7/10 anxiety spike, repeat 'This is uncomfortable and I can stand it' while slow-breathing for 2 minutes; resume when anxiety ≤3/10.
description.hindi: Grow 'I can stand it' beliefs for short-term discomfort during inclusive discussions. How it works example: During a 7/10 anxiety spike, repeat 'This is uncomfortable and I can stand it' while slow-breathing for 2 minutes; resume when anxiety ≤3/10.

description.english: Turn demands into preferences to reduce pressure and shame. How it works example: Create a two-column list: Demands → Preferences; read the preference column before health class to prime flexible thinking.
description.hindi: Turn demands into preferences to reduce pressure and shame. How it works example: Create a two-column list: Demands → Preferences; read the preference column before health class to prime flexible thinking.

description.english: Plan safe, age-appropriate exposures to harmless embarrassment to weaken shame. How it works example: After class, calmly ask the meaning of a neutral term; record outcome—no catastrophe, confidence +1.
description.hindi: Plan safe, age-appropriate exposures to harmless embarrassment to weaken shame. How it works example: After class, calmly ask the meaning of a neutral term; record outcome—no catastrophe, confidence +1.

description.english: Normalize setbacks and practice returning to rational beliefs after spikes. How it works example: If anxiety flares again, complete ABC, dispute the belief, choose a rational alternative, and take one small value-based action the same day.
